topic.title: Publishing Content to Content Fusion Docs Web Platform
topic.shortdesc: The Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector allows you to automatically upload and host your published deliverables on a publicly accessible web platform.

ul.li: Automatic Hosting: Published deliverables are automatically uploaded and made available online.
Public Access: Your published content can be accessed by anyone with the deployment URL.
Easy Sharing: Share deployment URLs with team members, stakeholders, or clients.
Automatic Connector Setup: The Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector is automatically created when you create a new project.

section.title: Creating the Content Fusion Docs Web Platform Connector
section.p: Automatic Connector Creation: The Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector is automatically created when you create a new project. The connector appears in your project's connector list with the name "Content Fusion Docs Web Platform".
Manual Connector Creation: If you need to create the connector manually:

ol.li: Go to your project's Connectors page.
Click Add Connector.
Select Content Fusion Docs as the connector type.
The connector will be created and ready to use.

section.note: Only one Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector can exist per project.

section.title: Using the Content Fusion Docs Web Platform Connector
section.p: Setting Up a Deliverable: To publish a deliverable using the Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector:

ol.li: Create or Edit a Deliverable: Go to your project's deliverables page and create a new deliverable or edit an existing one.

Enable Connector Upload:
Check the Upload using connector option.
Select Content Fusion Docs Web Platform from the connector dropdown.

Public Access Warning: When you select the Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector, you'll see a warning that the output will be publicly accessible. Make sure you're comfortable with this before proceeding.
Save and Publish: Save your deliverable settings and start a publishing task as usual.
The output files are automatically uploaded to the hosting platform.
A deployment is created and made available online.
The deployment URL is generated and can be accessed immediately.
The URL is displayed in the build output logs.

section.p: You can share this URL with anyone who needs to view your published content.

section.title: Managing Deployments
section.p: Viewing Deployments: You can view all deployments for your Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector:

ol.li: Go to your project's Connectors page.
Find the Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector.
Click the View Deployments button.

section.p: The Deployments dialog displays all successful deployments for your project, showing:

ul.li: Deliverable: The name and type of the deliverable (PDF or HTML5).
Build Number: The build number for this deployment.
Publication: The publication name used for this build.
Branch: The branch from which the content was published.
Deployment URL: A clickable link to view the published content online.

ol.li: Open the Deployments dialog (see above).
Click the Deployment URL link for the deployment you want to view.
The published content will open in a new browser tab.
Open the Deployments dialog.
Find the deployment you want to delete.
Click the Delete icon (trash can) next to the deployment.
Confirm the deletion in the confirmation dialog.

section.note: Deleting a deployment removes it from the hosting platform and the URL will no longer be accessible. If there's an active publishing task for the same deliverable, you'll see a warning before deletion. Once deleted, the deployment cannot be recovered.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.p: Public Access: Important: Content published using the Content Fusion Docs Web Platform connector is publicly accessible on the internet. Anyone with the deployment URL can view your published content.

p.b: Before using this connector, ensure that:

ul.li: The content you're publishing is appropriate for public access.
No sensitive or confidential information is included in the published output.
You understand that the content will be accessible to anyone with the URL.
